070/**
071 * JSON-RPC Client for <b>Bitcoin Core</b>.
072 * <p>
073 * A strongly-typed wrapper for a Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC client using the
074 * <a href="https://bitcoincore.org/en/doc/">Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC API</a>.
075 * <p>
076 * <a href="https://bitcoinj.org">bitcoinj</a> types are used where appropriate.
077 * For example, requesting a block hash will return a {@link org.bitcoinj.base.Sha256Hash}:
078 *
079 * <pre> {@code
080 * Sha256Hash hash = client.getBlockHash(342650);
081 * }</pre>
082 *
083 * Requesting a Bitcoin balance will return the amount as a {@link org.bitcoinj.base.Coin}:
084 *
085 * <pre> {@code
086 * Coin balance = client.getBalance();
087 * }</pre>
088 *
089 * This version is written to be compatible with Bitcoin Core 0.20 and later. If used with
090 * Omni Core (an enhanced version of Bitcoin Core with Omni Protocol support) Omni Core 0.11.0 or later is required.
091 * <p>
092 * Note that according to <a href="https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/2960">Issue #2960: Support JSON-RPC 2.0</a> Bitcoin Core
093 * does not correctly follow the JSON-RPC 2.0 specification.
094 * @see org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcClient
095 * @see <a href="https://bitcoincore.org/en/doc/">Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC API reference</a>
096 * @see <a href="https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/2960">Bitcoin Core Issue #2960: Support JSON-RPC 2.0</a>
097 * <p>
098 * <b>This is still a work-in-progress and the API will change.</b>
099 *
100 */
101public class BitcoinClient extends JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection implements ChainTipClient {
102    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BitcoinClient.class);
103
104    private static final int THREAD_POOL_SIZE = 5;
105
106    private static final int SECOND_IN_MSEC = 1000;
107    private static final int RETRY_SECONDS = 5;
108    private static final int MESSAGE_SECONDS = 30;
109
110    public static final int BITCOIN_CORE_VERSION_MIN = 200000;              // Minimum Bitcoin Core supported (tested) version
111    public static final int BITCOIN_CORE_VERSION_DESC_DEFAULT = 230000;     // Bitcoin Core version that DEFAULTS to descriptor wallets
112
113    private Network network;
114    private final ExecutorService executorService;
115
116    private int serverVersion = 0;    // 0 means unknown serverVersion
117    private boolean isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested = false;
118    private boolean isAddressIndexEnabled;
119
120    public BitcoinClient(SSLContext sslContext, Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
121        super(sslContext, JsonRpcMessage.Version.V2, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
122        this.network = network;
123        ThreadFactory threadFactory = new BitcoinClientThreadFactory(new Context(), "Bitcoin RPC Client");
124        // TODO: Tune and/or make configurable the thread pool size.
125        // Current pool size of 5 is chosen to minimize simultaneous active RPC
126        // calls in `bitcoind` -- which is not designed for serving multiple clients.
127        executorService = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(THREAD_POOL_SIZE, threadFactory);
128        mapper.registerModule(new RpcClientModule());
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * @deprecated Use {@link BitcoinClient#BitcoinClient(SSLContext, Network, URI, String, String)}
133     */
134    @Deprecated
135    public BitcoinClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory, Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
136        super(sslSocketFactory, JsonRpcMessage.Version.V2, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
137        this.network = network;
138        ThreadFactory threadFactory = new BitcoinClientThreadFactory(new Context(), "Bitcoin RPC Client");
139        executorService = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(THREAD_POOL_SIZE, threadFactory);
140        mapper.registerModule(new RpcClientModule());
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * @deprecated Use {@link BitcoinClient#BitcoinClient(SSLContext, Network, URI, String, String)}
145     */
146    @Deprecated
147    public BitcoinClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory, NetworkParameters netParams, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
148        this(sslSocketFactory, netParams.network(), server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
149    }

151    // TODO: Reconcile this constructor mode with {@link #waitForServer(int)}
152    /**
153     * Incubating constructor that doesn't require a {@link Network}.
154     * <p>
155     * When using this constructor, it is recommended that {@link #getNetwork()} be called after construction
156     * and before any other methods are called, to allow the Bitcoin network type to be initialized.
157     * @param sslContext Custom socket factory
158     * @param server URI of the Bitcoin RPC server
159     * @param rpcuser Username (if required)
160     * @param rpcpassword Password (if required)
161     */
162    public BitcoinClient(SSLContext sslContext, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
163        this(sslContext, (Network) null, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Incubating constructor that doesn't require a {@link Network}.
168     * <p>
169     * When using this constructor, it is recommended that {@link #getNetwork()} be called after construction
170     * and before any other methods are called, to allow the Bitcoin network type to be initialized.
171     * @param server URI of the Bitcoin RPC server
172     * @param rpcuser Username (if required)
173     * @param rpcpassword Password (if required)
174     */
175    public BitcoinClient(URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
176        this(getDefaultSSLContext(), (Network) null, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Construct a BitcoinClient from Network, URI, user name, and password.
181     * @param network Correct Network Parameters for destination server
182     * @param server URI of the Bitcoin RPC server
183     * @param rpcuser Username (if required)
184     * @param rpcpassword Password (if required)
185     */
186    public BitcoinClient(Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
187        this(getDefaultSSLContext(), network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
188    }

191    public BitcoinClient(NetworkParameters netParams, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
192        this(netParams.network(), server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
193    }
194
195    /**
196     * Construct a BitcoinClient from an RPCConfig data object.
197     * @param config Contains URI, user name, and password
198     */
199    public BitcoinClient(RpcConfig config) {
200        this(config.network(), config.getURI(), config.getUsername(), config.getPassword());
201    }
202
203    /**
204     * Get network parameters
205     * @return network parameters for the server
206     * @deprecated Use {@link #getNetwork()}
207     */
208    @Deprecated
209    public synchronized NetworkParameters getNetParams() {
210        return NetworkParameters.of(getNetwork());
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * Get network.
215     * <p>
216     * Historically the Bitcoin network has been required as a constructor parameter and required to match
217     * the mode of the server. However, to simplify client configuration we have added a constructor
218     * that doesn't require specification of a network. This changes some assumptions about how {@code BitcoinClient} works.
219     * Previously, no JSON-RPC I/O calls would be performed unless something was explicitly requested -- which
220     * also gave users of {@code BitcoinClient} the ability to call {@link #waitForServer(int)}
221     * before calling any RPCs.
222     * <p>
223     * Until further improvements/changes are made, if you use one of the constructors that does not specify a
224     * {@code Network} you should call {@link #getNetwork()} as soon as possible after calling the constructor
225     * (especially before calling any JSON-RPC I/O methods except {@link #waitForServer(int)}).
226     * @return network for the server
227     */
228    public synchronized Network getNetwork() {
229        if (network == null) {
230            network = getNetworkFromServer().join();
231        }
232        return network;
233    }
234
235    @Override
236    public ExecutorService getDefaultAsyncExecutor() {
237        return executorService;
238    }
239    
240    /**
241     * Shutdown our thread pool, etc.
242     *
243     * @throws InterruptedException if one happens
244     */
245    @Override
246    public void close() throws InterruptedException {
247        // TODO: See shutdownAndAwaitTermination method in the ExecutorService JavaDoc for how to correctly implement this.
248        executorService.shutdown();
249        boolean successfullyTerminated = executorService.awaitTermination(10, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
250        if (!successfullyTerminated) {
251            log.warn("timeout while closing");
252        }
253    }
254
255    /**
256     * Get a (cached after first call) serverVersion number
257     * @return serverVersion version of bitcoin server node
258     */
259    synchronized int getServerVersion() {
260        if (serverVersion == 0) {
261            try {
262                serverVersion = getNetworkInfo().getVersion();
263            } catch (IOException e) {
264                throw new RuntimeException(e);
265            }
266            if (serverVersion < BITCOIN_CORE_VERSION_MIN) {
267                throw new RuntimeException("Unsupported server version");
268            }
269        }
270        return serverVersion;
271    }
272
273    /**
274     * Get the {@link Network} for this client by asking the server.
275     * @return A future for the server-side {@code Network}
276     */
277    private CompletableFuture<Network> getNetworkFromServer() {
278        return getBlockchainInfoMap().thenApply(map -> {
279            Network network;
280            switch((String) map.get("chain")) {
281                case "main":
282                    network = BitcoinNetwork.MAINNET;
283                    break;
284                case "test":
285                    network = BitcoinNetwork.TESTNET;
286                    break;
287                case "signet":
288                    network = BitcoinNetwork.SIGNET;
289                    break;
290                case "regtest":
291                    network = BitcoinNetwork.REGTEST;
292                    break;
293                default:
294                    throw new RuntimeException("Server returned unrecognized Bitcoin network");
295
296            }
297            return network;
298        });
299    }
300
301    /**
302     * Return {@code BlockchainInfo} as a {@link Map}. This avoids use of {@link RpcClientModule} and a circular dependency on {@link Network}
303     * @return  {@code getblockchaininfo} response JSON as a {@link Map}
304     */
305    private CompletableFuture<Map<String, Object>> getBlockchainInfoMap() {
306        JsonRpcRequest request = buildJsonRequest("getblockchaininfo");
307        CompletableFuture<JsonRpcResponse<Map<String, Object>>> response = sendRequestForResponseAsync(request, responseTypeFor(Map.class));
308        return response.thenApply(JsonRpcResponse::getResult);
309    }
310
311    /**
312     * Test if address index is enabled, caching the result of the first successful check
313     *
314     * @return true if enabled, false if not enabled
315     * @throws JsonRpcException an exception other than 1 of the two expected exceptions is thrown
316     * @throws IOException something else went wrong
317     */
318    public synchronized boolean isAddressIndexEnabled() throws JsonRpcException, IOException {
319        if (!isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested) {
320            try {
321                AddressBalanceInfo info = getAddressBalance(getTestAddress());
322                isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested = true;
323                isAddressIndexEnabled = true;
324            } catch (JsonRpcErrorException ee) {
325                // If method not found, the method we use for the test isn't even present, so definitely
326                // no address index support is available
327                if (ee.getError().getCode() == JsonRpcError.Error.METHOD_NOT_FOUND.getCode()) {
328                    isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested = true;
329                    isAddressIndexEnabled = false;
330                } else {
331                    // Some other, unexpected exception, throw it
332                    throw ee;
333                }
334            } catch (JsonRpcStatusException se) {
335                // If the method is there and it returns an error of "Address index not enabled" then we also
336                // know that no address index support is available
337                if (se.getMessage().equals("Address index not enabled")) {
338                    isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested = true;
339                    isAddressIndexEnabled = false;
340                } else if ( se.jsonRpcCode == JsonRpcError.Error.METHOD_NOT_FOUND.getCode()) {
341                    // It looks like the behavior changed in Bitcoin Core v23.0 and we end up here rather than in the  JsonRpcErrorException handler above
342                    isAddressIndexSuccessfullyTested = true;
343                    isAddressIndexEnabled = false;
344                } else {
345                    // Some other, unexpected exception, throw it
346                    throw se;
347                }
348            }
349        }
350        return isAddressIndexEnabled;
351    }
352
353    private Address getTestAddress() {
354        BitcoinNetwork network = (BitcoinNetwork) getNetwork();
355        switch (network) {
356            case MAINNET:
357                return LegacyAddress.fromBase58( "1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNa", network);
358            case TESTNET:
359            case REGTEST:
360            case SIGNET:
361            default:
362                return LegacyAddress.fromBase58( "moneyqMan7uh8FqdCA2BV5yZ8qVrc9ikLP", network);
363        }
364    }
365
366    // TODO: Make this an async method that returns CompletableFuture.
367    // TODO: Consider renaming this method "connect"
368    // TODO: Consider having this method automatically get the Bitcoin Network, Server Version, RegTest mining address, etc once connection is made
369    /**
370     * Wait until the server is available.
371     *
372     * Keep trying, ignoring (and logging) a known list of exception conditions that may occur while waiting for
373     * a `bitcoind` server to start up. This is similar to the behavior enabled by the `-rpcwait`
374     * option to the `bitcoin-cli` command-line tool.
375     *
376     * @param timeout Timeout in seconds
377     * @return true if ready, false if timeout or interrupted
378     * @throws JsonRpcException if an "unexpected" exception happens (i.e. an error other than what happens during normal server startup)
379     */
380    public Boolean waitForServer(int timeout) throws JsonRpcException {
381
382        log.debug("Waiting for server RPC ready...");
383
384        String status;          // Status message for logging
385        String statusLast = null;
386        int seconds = 0;
387        while (seconds < timeout) {
388            try {
389                Integer block = this.getBlockCount();
390                if (block != null) {
391                    log.debug("RPC Ready.");
392                    return true;
393                }
394                status = "getBlock returned null";
395            } catch (SocketException se) {
396                // These are expected exceptions while waiting for a server
397                if (se.getMessage().equals("Unexpected end of file from server") ||
398                        se.getMessage().equals("Connection reset") ||
399                        se.getMessage().contains("Connection refused") ||
400                        se.getMessage().equals("recvfrom failed: ECONNRESET (Connection reset by peer)")) {
401                    status = se.getMessage();
402                } else {
403                    throw new JsonRpcException("Unexpected exception in waitForServer", se) ;
404                }
405
406            } catch (EOFException ignored) {
407                /* Android exception, ignore */
408                // Expected exceptions on Android, RoboVM
409                status = ignored.getMessage();
410            } catch (JsonRpcStatusException e) {
411                // If server is in "warm-up" mode, e.g. validating/parsing the blockchain...
412                if (e.jsonRpcCode == -28) {
413                    // ...then grab text message for status logging
414                    status = e.getMessage();
415                } else {
416                    log.error("Rethrowing JsonRpcStatusException: ", e);
417                    throw e;
418                }
419            } catch (IOException e) {
420                // Ignore all IOExceptions
421                status = e.getMessage();
422            }
423            try {
424                // Log status messages only once, if new or updated
425                if (!status.equals(statusLast)) {
426                    log.info("Waiting for server: RPC Status: " + status);
427                    statusLast = status;
428                }
429                Thread.sleep(RETRY_SECONDS * SECOND_IN_MSEC);
430                seconds += RETRY_SECONDS;
431            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
432                log.error(e.toString());
433                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
434                return false;
435            }
436        }
437
438        log.error("waitForServer() timed out after {} seconds.", timeout);
439        return false;
440    }
441
442    /**
443     * Wait for RPC server to reach specified block height.
444     *
445     * @param blockHeight Block height to wait for
446     * @param timeout     Timeout in seconds
447     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
448     * @throws IOException network error
449     * @return True if blockHeight reached, false if timeout or interrupted
450     */
451    public Boolean waitForBlock(int blockHeight, int timeout) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
452
453        log.info("Waiting for server to reach block " + blockHeight);
454
455        int seconds = 0;
456        while (seconds < timeout) {
457            Integer block = this.getBlockCount();
458            if (block >= blockHeight) {
459                log.info("Server is at block " + block + " returning 'true'.");
460                return true;
461            } else {
462                try {
463                    if (seconds % MESSAGE_SECONDS == 0) {
464                        log.debug("Server at block " + block);
465                    }
466                    Thread.sleep(RETRY_SECONDS * SECOND_IN_MSEC);
467                    seconds += RETRY_SECONDS;
468                } catch (InterruptedException e) {
469                    log.error(e.toString());
470                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
471                    return false;
472                }
473            }
474        }
475
476        log.error("Timeout waiting for block " + blockHeight);
477        return false;
478    }
479

481    /**
482     * Tell the server to stop
483     * @return A status string
484     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
485     * @throws IOException network error
486     */
487    public String stop() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
488        return send("stop");
489    }

491    /**
492     * Returns the number of blocks in the longest block chain.
493     *
494     * @return The current block count
495     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
496     * @throws IOException network error
497     */
498    public Integer getBlockCount() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
499        return send("getblockcount");
500    }
501
502    /**
503     * Returns the hash of block in best-block-chain at index provided.
504     *
505     * @param index The block index
506     * @return The block hash
507     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
508     * @throws IOException network error
509     */
510    public Sha256Hash getBlockHash(Integer index) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
511        return send("getblockhash", Sha256Hash.class, index);
512    }
513
514    /**
515     * Returns information about a block with the given block hash.
516     *
517     * @param hash The block hash
518     * @return The information about the block (JSON/POJO object)
519     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
520     * @throws IOException network error
521     */
522    public BlockInfo getBlockInfo(Sha256Hash hash) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
523        // Use "verbose = true"
524        return send("getblock", BlockInfo.class, hash, true);
525    }
526
527    /**
528     * Returns information about a block with the given block hash.
529     *
530     * @param hash The block hash
531     * @return The information about the block (bitcoinj {@link Block} object)
532     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
533     * @throws IOException network error
534     */
535    public Block getBlock(Sha256Hash hash) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
536        // Use "verbose = false"
537        return send("getblock", Block.class, hash, false);
538    }
539
540    /**
541     * Mine blocks immediately (RegTest mode)
542     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.13.0
543     *
544     * @param numBlocks Number of blocks to mine
545     * @param address Address to send mined coins to
546     * @param maxtries How many iterations to try (or null to use server default -- currently 1,000,000)
547     * @return list containing block header hashes of the generated blocks
548     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
549     * @throws IOException network error
550     */
551    public List<Sha256Hash> generateToAddress(int numBlocks, Address address, Integer maxtries) throws IOException {
552        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, Sha256Hash.class);
553        return send("generatetoaddress", resultType, (long) numBlocks, address, maxtries);
554    }
555
556    /**
557     * Mine blocks immediately (RegTest mode)
558     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.13.0
559     *
560     * @param numBlocks Number of blocks to mine
561     * @param address Address to send mined coins to
562     * @return list containing block header hashes of the generated blocks
563     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
564     * @throws IOException network error
565     */
566    public List<Sha256Hash> generateToAddress(int numBlocks, Address address) throws IOException {
567        return generateToAddress(numBlocks,address, null);
568    }
569
570    public List<String> listWallets() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
571        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, String.class);
572        return send("listwallets", resultType);
573    }

575    public LoadWalletResult createWallet(String name, Boolean disablePrivateKeys, Boolean blank) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
576        return createWallet(name, disablePrivateKeys, blank, null, null, null, null, null);
577    }
578
579    public LoadWalletResult createWallet(String name, Boolean disablePrivateKeys, Boolean blank, String passPhrase,
580                                         Boolean avoidReuse) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
581        return send("createwallet", LoadWalletResult.class, name, disablePrivateKeys, blank, passPhrase, avoidReuse);
582    }

584    // To use all these params server must be "recent"
585    public LoadWalletResult createWallet(String name, Boolean disablePrivateKeys, Boolean blank, String passPhrase,
586                                         Boolean avoidReuse, Boolean descriptors, Boolean loadOnStartup,
587                                         Boolean externalSigner) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
588        return send("createwallet", LoadWalletResult.class, name, disablePrivateKeys, blank, passPhrase, avoidReuse, descriptors, loadOnStartup, externalSigner);
589    }
590
591    public UnloadWalletResult unloadWallet() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
592        return unloadWallet(null, null);
593    }
594
595    public UnloadWalletResult unloadWallet(String name, Boolean loadOnStartup) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
596        return send("unloadwallet", UnloadWalletResult.class, name, loadOnStartup);
597    }

599    /**
600     * Creates a new Bitcoin address for receiving payments, linked to the default account "".
601     *
602     * @return A new Bitcoin address
603     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
604     * @throws IOException network error
605     */
606    public Address getNewAddress() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
607        return getNewAddress(null);
608    }
609
610    /**
611     * Creates a new Bitcoin address for receiving payments.
612     *
613     * @param label The label name for the address to be linked to.
614     * @return A new Bitcoin address
615     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
616     * @throws IOException network error
617     */
618    public Address getNewAddress(String label) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
619        return send("getnewaddress", Address.class, label);
620    }
621    
622    /**
623     * Return the private key from the server.
624     *
625     * Note: must be in wallet mode with unlocked or unencrypted wallet.
626     *
627     * @param address Address corresponding to the private key to return
628     * @return The private key
629     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
630     * @throws IOException network error
631     */
632    public ECKey dumpPrivKey(Address address) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
633        return send("dumpprivkey", ECKey.class, address);
634    }
635
636    /**
637     * Import a private key into the server's wallet
638     *
639     * @param privateKey An ECKey (containing a private key)
640     * @param label The server-side label for the key
641     * @param rescan Rescan the blockchain to find transactions for this key
642     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
643     * @throws IOException network error
644     */
645    public void importPrivKey(ECKey privateKey, String label, boolean rescan) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
646        send("importprivkey", Void.class, privateKey.getPrivateKeyEncoded(this.getNetwork()).toBase58(), label, rescan);
647    }
648    
649    /**
650     * Creates a raw transaction spending the given inputs to the given destinations.
651     *
652     * Note: the transaction inputs are not signed, and the transaction is not stored in the wallet or transmitted to
653     * the network.
654     *
655     * @param inputs  The outpoints to spent
656     * @param outputs The destinations and amounts to transfer
657     * @return The hex-encoded raw transaction
658     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
659     * @throws IOException network error
660     */
661    public String createRawTransaction(List<Outpoint> inputs, Map<Address, Coin> outputs)
662            throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
663        return send("createrawtransaction", inputs, outputs);
664    }
665
666    /**
667     * Signs inputs of a raw transaction using the wallet. Arguments 2 and 3 of the RPC are currently
668     * not supported, which means UTXOs not currently in the blockchain can't be used and `sighashtype`
669     * defaults to `ALL`.
670     *
671     * @param unsignedTransaction The hex-encoded raw transaction
672     * @return The signed transaction and information whether it has a complete set of signature
673     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
674     * @throws IOException network error
675     * @since Bitcoin Core v0.17
676     */
677    public SignedRawTransaction signRawTransactionWithWallet(String unsignedTransaction) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
678        return send("signrawtransactionwithwallet", SignedRawTransaction.class, unsignedTransaction);
679    }
680
681    /**
682     * Get a "raw" transaction (which we use to construct a bitcoinj {@code Transaction})
683     * @param txid Transaction ID/hash
684     * @return bitcoinj Transaction
685     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
686     * @throws IOException network error
687     */
688    public Transaction getRawTransaction(Sha256Hash txid) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
689        String hexEncoded = send("getrawtransaction", txid);
690        byte[] raw = HexUtil.hexStringToByteArray(hexEncoded);
691        return Transaction.read(ByteBuffer.wrap(raw));
692    }
693
694    /**
695     * Get a "raw" transaction as JSON (which we map to a RawTransactionInfo POJO)
696     * @param txid Transaction ID/hash
697     * @return RawTransactionInfo POJO
698     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
699     * @throws IOException network error
700     */
701    public RawTransactionInfo getRawTransactionInfo(Sha256Hash txid) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
702        return send("getrawtransaction", RawTransactionInfo.class, txid, 1);
703    }
704
705    /**
706     * Submit a raw transaction to local node and network
707     *
708     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.19
709     * @param tx The raw transaction
710     * @param maxFeeRate  Reject transactions whose fee rate is higher than this value, expressed in BTC/kB.
711     *                    Set to 0 to accept any fee rate.
712     * @return SHA256 Transaction ID
713     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
714     * @throws IOException network error
715     */
716    public Sha256Hash sendRawTransaction(Transaction tx, Coin maxFeeRate) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
717        return send("sendrawtransaction", Sha256Hash.class, tx, maxFeeRate);
718    }
719
720    /**
721     * Submit a raw transaction to local node and network
722     *
723     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.19
724     * @param hexTx The raw transaction as a hex-encoded string
725     * @param maxFeeRate  Reject transactions whose fee rate is higher than this value, expressed in BTC/kB.
726     *                    Set to 0 to accept any fee rate.
727     * @return SHA256 Transaction ID
728     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
729     * @throws IOException network error
730     */
731    public Sha256Hash sendRawTransaction(String hexTx, Coin maxFeeRate) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
732        return send("sendrawtransaction", Sha256Hash.class, hexTx, maxFeeRate);
733    }

739     * @return SHA256 Transaction ID
740     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
741     * @throws IOException network error
742     */
743    public Sha256Hash sendRawTransaction(Transaction tx) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
744        return sendRawTransaction(tx, (Coin) null);
745    }

755     */
756    public Sha256Hash sendRawTransaction(String hexTx) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {

966    /**
967     * List wallet transactions.
968     * @param label Return transactions matching this address label, use "*" to return all transactions. {@code null} will use the server default ({@code "*"})
969     * @param count Maximum number of transactions to return. {@code null} will use the sever default number (10)
970     * @return A list of wallet transactions
971     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
972     * @throws IOException network error
973     */
974    public List<BitcoinTransactionInfo> listTransactions(String label, Integer count) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
975        return listTransactions(label, count, null, null);
976    }
977    /**
978     * List wallet transactions
979     * @param label Return transactions matching this address label, use "*" to return all transactions. {@code null} will use the server default ({@code "*"})
980     * @param count Maximum number of transactions to return. {@code null} will use the sever default number (10)
981     * @param skip Number of transactions to skip. {@code null} will use the server default (0)
982     * @param includeWatchOnly Include transactions to/from watch-only addresses. {@code null} will use the server default, which is  ({@code true}) for watch-only wallets, {@code false} otherwise.
983     * @return A list of wallet transactions
984     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
985     * @throws IOException network error
986     */
987    public List<BitcoinTransactionInfo> listTransactions(String label, Integer count, Integer skip, Boolean includeWatchOnly) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
988        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, BitcoinTransactionInfo.class);
989        return send("listtransactions", resultType, label, count, skip, includeWatchOnly);
990    }

1027    /**
1028     * Returns list of related addresses.
1029     * Also useful for finding all change addresses in the wallet
1030     * @return a list of address groupings
1031     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1032     * @throws IOException network error
1033     */
1034    public List<List<AddressGroupingItem>>  listAddressGroupings() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1035        TypeFactory tf = mapper.getTypeFactory();
1036        JavaType agiListType = tf.constructCollectionType(List.class, AddressGroupingItem.class);
1037        JavaType resultType = tf.constructCollectionType(List.class, agiListType);
1038        return send("listaddressgroupings", resultType);

1040
1041    /**
1042     * Returns a human-readable list of available commands.
1043     * <p>
1044     * Bitcoin Core 0.10+ returns a categorized list of commands including blank lines
1045     * and header lines.
1046     *
1047     * @return The list of commands as string
1048     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1049     * @throws IOException network error
1050     */
1051    public String help() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1052        return help(null);
1053    }
1054
1055    /**
1056     * Returns a human-readable list of available commands.
1057     *
1058     * @return The response as a stream of one {@link String} for each line
1059     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1060     * @throws IOException network error
1061     */
1062    public Stream<String> helpAsStream() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1063        return lines(help());
1064    }
1065
1066    /**
1067     * Returns a human-readable list of available commands.
1068     *
1069     * @return The response as a list one {@link String} for each line
1070     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1071     * @throws IOException network error
1072     */
1073    public List<String> helpAsLines() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1074        return helpAsStream().collect(Collectors.toList());
1075    }
1076
1077    /**
1078     * Returns a human-readable list of available commands.
1079     *
1080     * @return The response as a list one {@link MethodHelpEntry} for each method
1081     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1082     * @throws IOException network error
1083     */
1084    public List<MethodHelpEntry> helpAsMethodEntries() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1085        return helpAsStream()
1086                .filter(this::isMethodEntry)
1087                .map(MethodHelpEntry::new)
1088                .collect(Collectors.toList());
1089    }
1090
1091    /**
1092     * Returns helpful information for a specific command.
1093     *
1094     * @param command The name of the command to get help for
1095     * @return The help text
1096     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1097     * @throws IOException network error
1098     */
1099    public String help(String command) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1100        return send("help", command);
1101    }
1102
1103    /**
1104     * Returns a list of available commands.
1105     *
1106     * Commands which are unavailable will not be listed, such as wallet RPCs, if wallet support is disabled.
1107     *
1108     * @return The list of commands
1109     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1110     * @throws IOException network error
1111     */
1112    public List<String> getCommands() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1113        return helpAsMethodEntries().stream()
1114                .map(MethodHelpEntry::getMethodName)
1115                .collect(Collectors.toList());
1116    }
1117
1118    private Stream<String> lines(String string) {
1119        // In JDK 11 this can be replaced by String::lines
1120        return Stream.of(string.split("\n"));
1121    }
1122
1123    private boolean isMethodEntry(String line) {
1124        // Filter out blank and header lines
1125        return !line.isEmpty() && !line.matches("== (.+) ==");
1126    }
1127
1128    /**
1129     * Checks whether a command exists.
1130     *
1131     * This is done indirectly, by using {help(String) help} to get information about the command, and if information
1132     * about the command is available, then the command exists. The absence of information does not necessarily imply
1133     * the non-existence of a command.
1134     *
1135     * @param command The name of the command to check
1136     * @return True if the command exists
1137     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1138     * @throws IOException network error
1139     */
1140    public Boolean commandExists(String command) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1141        return !help(command).contains("help: unknown command");
1142    }
1143
1144    /**
1145     * Permanently marks a block as invalid, as if it violated a consensus rule.
1146     *
1147     * @param hash The block hash
1148     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.10
1149     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1150     * @throws IOException network error
1151     */
1152    public void invalidateBlock(Sha256Hash hash) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1153        send("invalidateblock", hash);
1154    }
1155
1156    /**
1157     * Removes invalidity status of a block and its descendants, reconsider them for activation.
1158     * <p>
1159     * This can be used to undo the effects of {link invalidateBlock(Sha256Hash) invalidateBlock}.
1160     *
1161     * @param hash The hash of the block to reconsider
1162     * @since Bitcoin Core 0.10
1163     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1164     * @throws IOException network error
1165     */
1166    public void reconsiderBlock(Sha256Hash hash) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1167        send("reconsiderblock", hash);
1168    }

1175     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1176     * @throws IOException network error
1177     */
1178    @Override
1179    public List<ChainTip> getChainTips() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
1180        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, ChainTip.class);
1181        return send("getchaintips",resultType);
1182    }

1189     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
1190     * @throws IOException network error
1191     */
1192    public void addNode(String node, String command) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {

1225
1226    // Bitcore/Omni transaction for getting non-wallet address balances
1227    public AddressBalanceInfo getAddressBalance(List<Address> addressList) throws JsonRpcException, IOException {
1228        return send("getaddressbalance", AddressBalanceInfo.class, new AddressRequest(addressList));
1229    }
1230
1231    // Bitcore/Omni transaction for getting non-wallet address UTXO Info
1232    public List<AddressUtxoInfo>  getAddressUtxos(Address address) throws JsonRpcException, IOException {
1233        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, AddressUtxoInfo.class);
1234        return send("getaddressutxos", resultType, address);
1235    }
1236
1237    // Bitcore/Omni transaction for getting non-wallet address UTXO Info
1238    public List<AddressUtxoInfo> getAddressUtxos(List<Address> addressList) throws JsonRpcException, IOException {
1239        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, AddressUtxoInfo.class);
1240        return send("getaddressutxos", resultType, new AddressRequest(addressList));
1241    }
